title: Methods for Colours
text: palettes R package working colour palettes. goal palettes provide methods working colour palettes, particularly developers want make colour palette package. early development.

title: Methods for Colours
text: Install development version GitHub :

title: Methods for Colours
text: Colours can specified name (listed grDevices::colours()):  hex code:  Multiple colours can specified character vector:  Named colour palettes can specified way:  Colours also work tibbles:
code: library(tibble) library(palettes) pal_colour("red") pal_colour("#FF0000") pal_colour(c("#FF0000", "blue", "green")) pal_palette(   palette_1 = c("#FF0000", "blue", "green"),   palette_2 = c(c("yellow", "orange", "purple")) ) tibble(   colours = pal_colour(c("#FF0000", "blue", "green")) )

title: Methods for Colours
text: See https://mccarthy-m-g.github.io/palettes/ also installed package: help(package = "palettes").

title: Arithmetic operators — arithmetic
text: unary operators perform "arithmetic" pal_colour vectors (objects can coerced ).

title: Arithmetic operators — arithmetic
text: x, y pal_colour vectors objects can coerced .

title: Arithmetic operators — arithmetic
text: Unary + returns pal_colour vector.

title: Arithmetic operators — arithmetic
code: x <- pal_colour("red") y <- pal_colour("blue") x + y #> <palettes_colour[1]> #> • #800080

what: Convert colour palette to a tibble — as_tibble.palettes_colour
title: Convert colour palette to a tibble — as_tibble.palettes_colour
text: Function converts colour palette object tibble.

title: Convert colour palette to a tibble — as_tibble.palettes_colour
code: # S3 method for palettes_colour as_tibble(x, ...)  # S3 method for palettes_palette as_tibble(x, ...)

title: Convert colour palette to a tibble — as_tibble.palettes_colour
text: x object class palettes_palette palettes_colour.

title: Convert colour palette to a tibble — as_tibble.palettes_colour
text: tibble.

title: Convert colour palette to a tibble — as_tibble.palettes_colour
code: x <- pal_colour(c("red", "green", "blue")) as_tibble(x) #> # A tibble: 3 × 1 #>   colour    #>   <colour>  #> 1 • #FF0000 #> 2 • #00FF00 #> 3 • #0000FF  y <- pal_palette(   pal1 = c("red", "green", "blue"),   pal2 = c("yellow", "orange", "purple") ) as_tibble(y) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   palette colour    #>   <chr>   <colour>  #> 1 pal1    • #FF0000 #> 2 pal1    • #00FF00 #> 3 pal1    • #0000FF #> 4 pal2    • #FFFF00 #> 5 pal2    • #FFA500 #> 6 pal2    • #A020F0

title: Math functions — math
text: functions perform "math" pal_colour vectors (objects can coerced ).

title: Math functions — math
text: x pal_colour vector object can coerced one.

title: Math functions — math
text: pal_colour vector.

title: Math functions — math
code: x <- pal_colour(c("red", "blue")) sum(x) #> <palettes_colour[1]> #> • #800080  x <- pal_colour(c("red", "blue", "yellow")) cumsum(x) #> <palettes_colour[3]> #> • #FF0000 #> • #800080 #> • #C08040

title: colour vector — pal_colour
text: creates character vector represents colours printed, colours formatted hexadecimal strings.

title: colour vector — pal_colour
text: x pal_colour(): character vector three kinds R colour specifications. as_colour(): object coerced. is_colour(): object test.

title: colour vector — pal_colour
text: S3 vector class palettes_colour.

title: colour vector — pal_colour
text: Colours can specified using either: colour name (listed colours()) hexadecimal string form "#rrggbb" "#rrggbbaa" (see rgb) positive integer meaning palette()[].

text: ... pal_palette(): list character vector three kinds R colour specifications.

title: colour palettes — pal_palette
text: Colours can specified using either: colour name (listed colours()) hexadecimal string form "#rrggbb" "#rrggbbaa" (see rgb) positive integer meaning palette()[].

title: Plot colour palette — plot.palettes_colour
text: x object class palettes_palette palettes_colour.

title: Plot colour palette — plot.palettes_colour
code: x <- pal_colour(c("red", "green", "blue")) plot(x)   y <- pal_palette(my_pal = c("red", "green", "blue")) plot(y)   z <- pal_palette(   pal1 = c("red", "green", "blue"),   pal2 = c("yellow", "orange", "purple") ) plot(z)

title: Colour scales from palettes — scale_colour_palette_d
text: Colour scales palettes

title: Colour scales from palettes — scale_colour_palette_d
code: scale_colour_palette_d(palette, direction = 1, ...)  scale_fill_palette_d(palette, direction = 1, ...)  scale_colour_palette_c(palette, direction = 1, ...)  scale_fill_palette_c(palette, direction = 1, ...)  scale_colour_palette_b(palette, direction = 1, ...)  scale_fill_palette_b(palette, direction = 1, ...)

title: Colour scales from palettes — scale_colour_palette_d
text: palette colour palette class palettes_palette. direction Sets order colours scale. 1, default, colours ordered first last -1, order colours reversed. ... arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale(), ggplot2::continuous_scale(), ggplot2::binned_scale control name, limits, breaks, labels forth.

title: Colour scales from palettes — scale_colour_palette_d
code: library(ggplot2)  rgb_pal <- pal_palette(rgb = c("red", "green", "blue"))  # Use palette_d with discrete data ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, colour = as.factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_colour_palette_d(rgb_pal)   # Use palette_c with continuous data ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, colour = mpg)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_colour_palette_c(rgb_pal)   # Use palette_b to bin continuous data before mapping ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, colour = mpg)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_colour_palette_b(rgb_pal)
